result.execSummary:
The defendant Ryan M Hart was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Ryan M Hart is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Ryan M Hart was found guilty of Identity Theft - Obtain Money or Credit [Modifiers: PTAC], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.203(2)(a).
  • Ryan M Hart was found guilty of Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consec to other sentences.  Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.  Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

superMiscConds.notes: $250 DNA surcharge remitted. $278  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervison or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.

Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.

charges.descr: Identity Theft - Obtain Money or Credit

supervisions.notes: Costs in the amount of $243 in Count #3 of Case #14CF314 to be collected by Dept of Corrections as a condition of probation in ct 1.
Concur to ct 1.  To be served in WPS pursuant to sec. 973.03(2).
